in his house.  Patient was seen by neurology who felt that his 
symptoms were due to intoxication by benzodiazpines.  He did 
not demonstrate any benzodiazepine withdrawal symptoms and his 
mental status returned to baseline.

# Accidental poisoning by Amiodarone, initial 
# Prolonged QT / Abnormal EKG
# Atrial fibrillation

prolonged Qt>600ms with flattened twaves, all characteristic of 
amiodarone toxicity.  Patient reported he may have gotten

primary electrophysiology team, who recommended stopping his 
amiodarone.  Qtc improved to < 500ms over subsequent 48 hours.
